1.description: Secure RDP ports to prevent threat actors from abusing and leveraging RDP tools.

3.description: Implement EDR solutions to disrupt threat actor memory allocation techniques.

4.command: Apply recommendations for remote access software
4.description: Secure remote access software by applying recommendations from the joint Guide to Securing Remote Access Software.

5.description: Implement application controls to manage and control execution of software, including allowlisting remote access programs.

6.description: Implement log collection best practices and use intrusion detection systems to defend against threat actors manipulating firewall configurations through early detection.

7.description: Strictly limit the use of RDP and other remote desktop services. If RDP is necessary, rigorously apply best practices.

8.description: Disable command-line and scripting activities and permissions.

9.description: Review domain controllers, servers, workstations, and active directories for new and/or unrecognized accounts.

10.description: Audit user accounts with administrative privileges and configure access controls according to the principle of least privilege (PoLP).

11.description: Implement time-based access for accounts at the admin level and higher.

12.description: Implement a recovery plan to maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location.

13.description: Maintain offline backups of data and regularly maintain backup and restoration (daily or weekly at minimum).

14.description: Require all accounts with password logins to comply with NIST's standards for developing and managing password policies.

15.description: Require phishing-resistant multifactor authentication (MFA) for all services to the extent possible.

16.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware.

17.description: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity and potential traversal of the indicated ransomware with a networking monitoring tool.

18.description: Install, regularly update, and enable real time detection for antivirus software on all hosts.

20.description: Consider adding an email banner to emails received from outside your organization.
